author: John Hooper
title: Vatican Treasures Star in a Glittering Met Exhibit
text:
ROME—In his 1972 movie ‘Roma,’ Italian director Federico Fellini imagined a Vatican fashion show, with models strutting, cycling and even roller-skating down the catwalk to present the latest in improbable ecclesiastical apparel.

An exhibition opening May 10 at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York and previewed here Feb. 26, looks at the sumptuous reality behind Fellini’s bizarre sequence—and one that at times isn’t far from the director’s fantasy. “Heavenly Bodies: Fashion and the Catholic Imagination” is the largest...
